paragraphs.content: Psalm 22
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 22

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Aijeleth Shahar, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Aijeleth Shahar, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?
paragraphs.contentHtml: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

paragraphs.content: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

paragraphs.content: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

paragraphs.content: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

paragraphs.content: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

paragraphs.content: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

paragraphs.content: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,
paragraphs.contentHtml: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

paragraphs.content: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He trusted on the Lord that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

paragraphs.content: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother’s breasts.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother’s breasts.

paragraphs.content: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother’s belly.

paragraphs.content: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

paragraphs.content: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.

paragraphs.content: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

paragraphs.content: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

paragraphs.content: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

paragraphs.content: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

paragraphs.content: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

paragraphs.content: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

paragraphs.content: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But be not thou far from me, O Lord: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

paragraphs.content: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

paragraphs.content: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Save me from the lion’s mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

paragraphs.content: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

paragraphs.content: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Ye that fear the Lord, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

paragraphs.content: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

paragraphs.content: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

paragraphs.content: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the Lord that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

paragraphs.content: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the Lord: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

paragraphs.content: For the kingdom is the LORD’s: and he is the governor among the nations.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the kingdom is the Lord’s: and he is the governor among the nations.

paragraphs.content: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

paragraphs.content: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

paragraphs.content: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.
